Heat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and lightly grease a large baking sheet.

Combine flour, softened margarine, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. Add 1 cup of buttermilk and an egg, then mix well. Transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface, knead gently, shape into a round loaf, and position it on the greased baking sheet. Keep in mind that the dough may be slightly sticky.
Brush the loaf with a mixture of melted butter and 1/4 cup of buttermilk, then use a sharp knife to create an 'X' on the top of the loaf.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean, which typically takes about 45 to 50 minutes. Check for doneness after 30 minutes, and feel free to continue brushing the loaf with the butter mixture while it bakes.
